title: Increasing the Hardness of Aluminum Alloys Used in the Aerospace Industry by Recycling Lithium Batteries
content: The significant increase in the use of rechargeable lithium-ion batteries (LiBs) has been fueled by the energy needs of the communications, electronics, and automotive sectors [1]. This will result in substantial quantities of waste from lithium-ion batteries (LiBs). Currently, used LiBs are typically either stored in large quantities or disposed of in landfills, posing a significant risk to the environment and public health [2, 3].
